title: Internet banking through antivirus software
content:
Ever since updating Firefox to version 115.1, I have an issue with correct accessing to banking website through an additional Firefox tab, secured by antivirus software. In my case it is ESET Internet Security. Normally once I tried to access a banking website on Firefox, antivirus automatically put me through to a secured tab. Since the update, it's not happening and the only way to do it is to force antivirus to used that security addon on all websites, not just those selected in the program. I see no reason to use it apart from banking websites. I would like to point out that other browsers I have tried don't have that problem. And it's definitely not a problem with antivirus software, since there were no changes or updates to ESET software between period when Firefox received updates. I have also tried out a beta release of Firefox (116) and the problem is present there as well.

I am waiting for your feedback. Thank you in advance. Michał Baranowski
creator: michal_baranowski1

title: open tab order after using the address bar changed in FF115
content:
Hello,

Until FF114 when I opened links in new tabs from the active tab, the new tabs were always opened next to the active tab, relative to the order they were opened (first link immediately on the right, second link on the right of the second link and so on). Switching to another tab reset the context and links were opened on the right of the new active tab. However entering a new location in the address bar didn't reset the context and links were still opened relative to the order they were opened from the active tab, regardless of the location in the address bar. Let's say I visit site A and open three links, then visit site B by entering its address in the address bar without changing of tab. Opening a fourth link will open a fourth tab after the three others.

In FF115 the behavior is different. When entering a location in the address bar, the context is reset and new tabs are opened immediately on the right of the active tab, as if I had moved to another tab.

Is there a way to restore the old behavior?

I'm running FF115 on Fedora 38 in case it matters. I tried with an empty profile and without any add-ons to be sure there is nothing wrong with my profile and add-ons.

Thanks.
creator: firefox2376

title: GoToMeeting Using Firefox
content:
I have been using Firefox and GoToMeeting for years, suddenly this month (July 2023) I get the following message when I try to open a GoToMeeting session”

“Sorry, this browser isn’t supported. Join in your browser by opening the link below in Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge.”

I don’t want to use either of those browsers.

What can I do to keep both Firefox and GoToMeeting?

title: Home screen shortcuts behaving abnormally
content:
My home screen shortcuts are behaving abnormally. The icons disappeared and were replaced by the first letter of the title field for the link - a few of the shortcuts were gone. After a short while some of the original icons reappeared, but not all. In addition, a few of my shortcuts have been randomly replaced by shortcuts to web sites that I have just visited. This seems to have started with the most recent Firefox update. Is this unique to me? Any feedback would be appreciated. 

                                                                                                  Bill
creator: wg5

title: Internet Keeps Getting Disconnect Since Version 115.0.1
content: I am having an issue with Firefox every since the Version 115.0.1 update where Firefox keeps saying my internet has been disconnected when it hasn't. I am using fiber optics, I've got other things running that never crash on different devices yet since the update only Firefox gives me this error. I can be playing an online game without any connection issues, running Hulu on my PS4, but when I use Firefox at least a dozen times a day I get this disconnect issue. I am only using uBlock Origin as an extension.
creator: Nightlistic

title: Firefox refuses to open completely
content: I have gone through basically all of the troubleshooting and fixes possible to get firefox to start. I uninstalled firefox completely including the profile folders from both the local and roaming locations, I've tried starting in safe mode/troubleshooting mode. All it does when I try opening is flash the window for half a second. In task manager it pops up for half a second, I can't even check the properties, cancel the process tree, etc. Even worse: there is no crash reports/files.

title: Win 7, windows explorer not responding after updating to FF 114.0.2
content:
Was having troubles accessing tinkercad.com. Updated to Firefox 114.0.2 on win 7 64 pro. This did not happen until upgraded firefox. And it did not happen in EDGE. I have system restored, and went back to the site not responding. updated fire fox again, and it keeps happening.

My win 7 works fine, and no, I do not want to update windows on this computer. thank you for your help.
creator: bulldog98714

title: F5 page refresh does not auto-scroll to top of page
content: I view a page, for example, news.yahoo.com. I usually scroll down a way, possibly to the bottom. I step away, and when I come back I want to refresh the page. Up until about two weeks ago, when I press F5 to refresh the page, it would automatically scroll back to the top of the page. Now it seems to go to (maybe) a percentage of the page based on where it was last scrolled. I then have to manually scroll back to the top to see the latest headlines. Was Firefox behavior changed? Is there a setting to control page refresh behavior?
creator: pwrgreg007
